The Pilgrim Fathers
     In the midst of exile and hardship their [the Pilgrim fathers] love and faith waxed strong. They trusted the Lord's promises, and He did not fail them in time of need. His angels were by their side, to encourage and support them. And when God's hand seemed pointing them across the sea, to a land where they might found for themselves a state, and leave to their children the precious
247
heritage of religious liberty, they went forward, without shrinking, in the path of providence.—GC 291.
